Pre-Game Insights: Can Cape Verde’s Home Form Hold Against Mauritania’s Revival?
Cape Verde’s Defensive Record: Cape Verde have kept five clean sheets in their last six home games, demonstrating their ability to shut down opposing attacks when playing in Praia.
Mauritania’s Struggles on the Road: Mauritania have failed to win in their last two away matches, drawing 0-0 with South Sudan and losing 2-0 to Congo DR.
Low-Scoring Matches: Both teams have been involved in low-scoring matches recently, with five of Cape Verde’s last seven games producing under 2.5 goals.
Mauritania’s Attacking Frailties: Mauritania’s last seven matches have also seen fewer than 2.5 goals scored, making a tight, low-scoring contest the most likely outcome in this encounter.
